required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Plasma and Intrapulmonary Concentrations Study of WCK 5222
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 1, Multiple-Dose, Open-Label Study to Determine and Compare Plasma and Intrapulmonary Concentrations of WCK 5222 (Cefepime and Zidebactam) in Healthy Adult Human Subjects

brief_summary.textblock: This is a Phase 1, multiple dose, open-label pharmacokinetic study in healthy adult male and female subjects.

primary_outcome.measure: concentrations of cefepime (FEP) and zidebactam in epithelial lining fluid (ELF)
concentrations of cefepime (FEP) and zidebactam in alveolar macrophage (AM)

arm_group.description: total of 7 doses of FEP-ZID via intravenous infusion over 60 min at q8hr dosing regimen

intervention.description: A total of 7 doses of FEP-ZID via intravenous infusion over 60 min at q8hr dosing regimen

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Body mass index (BMI) greater than or equal to18.5 and less than or equal to 30 (kg per m2) and weight between 55.0 and 100.0 kg (both inclusive).
- Medical history without any major pathology as judged by the Investigator.
- Forced expiratory volume in 1 second (FEV1) of at least 70% of predicted value at screening.
Exclusion Criteria:
- History or presence of significant oncologic, cardiovascular, pulmonary, hepatic, renal, hematological, gastrointestinal,endocrine, immunologic, dermatologic, neurological, or psychiatric disease.
- Positive alcohol breath test or urine drug screen test at screening or confinement.
- Current use or has used tobacco or nicotine containing products 6 month prior to screening.
- Positive testing for HIV, Hepatitis B or Hepatitis C.
- History or presence of alcohol or drug abuse within the 2 years prior to screening.
